intro: Parosela fremontii var. johnsonii, commonly known as the Johnson's parosela, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
